articles.author: Amina Ismail, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: With U.S. elections approaching, officials, diplomats and other sources in the region say Israel is seeking to shield its borders and ensure its rivals cannot regroup.
articles.title: Israel intensifies offensive in Gaza, Lebanon after Hamas leader's death

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Cuba's efforts to restore power to the island were derailed for a third time late on Saturday, Cuban authorities said shortly before midnight, leaving millions in the dark and raising fresh questions over the viability of the government's bid to reestablish electrical service.
articles.title: Cuba suffers third major setback in restoring power to island, millions still in dark

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is investigating the leak of a pair of highly classified intelligence documents describing Israel's preparations for a retaliatory strike on Iran, House Speaker Mike Johnson said on Sunday.
articles.title: US investigates leak on intelligence about Israel's Iran attack plans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Black Sea Fleet has been forced to move many warships from the naval base of Sevastopol on the Crimean peninsular, which Russia annexed in 2014, due to attacks by Ukraine, a Russian-installed official was quoted as saying on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukraine attacks forced Black Sea Fleet to move warships from Sevastopol, Russian official says

articles.author: Ananda Teresia, Stefanno Sulaiman
articles.description: Indonesia's Prabowo Subianto on Sunday will take over as president of the world's third-largest democracy after sweeping the country's election with policies like free meals for school children and with the outgoing leader's son as his running mate.
articles.title: Former special forces commander Prabowo to take up Indonesian presidency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Oscar is expected to reach Guantanamo or Holguin in Cuba later on Sunday as the island country struggles to restore power after its worst blackout in years, the U.S. National Hurricane Center said.
articles.title: Hurricane Oscar heads for Cuba after making landfall in Bahamas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The charges, which Rigathi Gachagua denies, included gross violation of the constitution and stirring ethnic hatred
articles.title: Kenya's impeached deputy president says his security withdrawn, safety at risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India's envoy to Canada, who is being expelled over what Ottawa says are links to the murder of a Sikh leader, insisted in an interview he was innocent and said Prime Minister Justin Trudeau had wrecked bilateral political ties.
articles.title: Trudeau has wrecked Canada-India political relations, says expelled envoy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Canadian Broadcasting Corp said the result could depend on out-of-district votes and mail-in ballots.
articles.title: No clear winner in British Columbia election, with most votes counted

articles.author: Portia Crowe, Ngouda Dione
articles.description: "Ten minutes later, they called me: 'there's no more house, no more son'."
articles.title: 'Everything is lost': Senegal repatriates citizens escaping Lebanon
